column4: whats the best way to implement plugins for flash , tv streaming and other related in Firefox?
for video, sudo apt-get install mozilla-mplayer
are you using ubuntu firefox or did you install the firefox from firefox, I know there are some scripts that do that and quite a few people do it
do ls /usr/lib/firefox/plugins, there should be a libflashplayer.so in there
or more accurately a symbolic link to libflashplayer.so
you are saying that flash works in one of your browsers?
all I asked was whether one thing was in there. All you had to do was read the output, look for libflashplayer.so and then tell me if it was there
ok, so now do ls /usr/lib/flashplugin-nonfree, tell me if libflashplayer.so is in there
hmmm, ok one more spot, ls /usr/lib/mozilla-firefox/plugins, see if libflashplayer.so is in there
or actually there is one more than that, ls /usr/lib/mozilla/plugins
what browser does flash work in?
open a fresh terminal and do this: wget http://3v1n0.tuxfamily.org/pool/edgy/3v1n0/flashplugin-nonfree_9.0.21.78-3v1ubuntu0_i386.deb && sudo dpkg -i flashplugin-nonfree_9.0.21.78-3v1ubuntu0_i386.deb
what happened when you did that?
